inventory.commentary: Could not find any instances of pop with WN 4 "fire a weapon" so I just stuck it in sense group 2.

sense.name: (cause to) burst or open, usually with a sharp sound
sense.commentary: Note: Includes metaphorical uses, "I'm not known as a guy who is free with his money, but I'd pop for one of those screen protectors."
sense.examples: The balloon popped. She popped the blister. He popped the champagne bottle. Let's pop a few beers after work. Would you pop the trunk?

sense.name: make a short, sharp sound
sense.commentary: Note: If there is any implication of bursting open, tag with sense 1.
sense.examples: I could hear his joints popping from across the room. The sound of Gatlin guns popping in the distance abruptly ended our revelry.

sense.name: move suddenly into or out of a location, appear suddenly
sense.commentary: Includes: POP IN, POP OUT, POP OFF
sense.examples: We could see prairie dogs popping out of their holes all across the field. You stick a bill in the vending machine and the change pops out. When he stretch his arms, all the buttons popped off his shirt. I popped in to the park to have a quick look around. She popped out to grab some lunch. Rob said he would pop in tomorrow for a chat. What grates my cheese is when you pop off into a shopping centre to buy milk.

sense.name: cause to move suddenly in a particular direction, release suddenly
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 POP NP2 PP Includes: POP THE QUESTION
sense.examples: She popped the pizza into the oven. He popped the clutch to start the car. He popped the cracked tile off the wall. He popped the lozenge into his mouth, then grimaced at the bitter taste.

sense.name: bulge outward
sense.examples: His eyes popped when he heard Gordon's salary. When she saw her mother's outfit, her eyes popped out. His back muscles popped out of his T-shirt.

sense.name: Baseball: hit
sense.examples: Julio popped him right in the nose, and down he went. Next time up she batted right and popped one into left field for another homer.

sense.name: injest orally, take drugs orally
sense.examples: She's been popping pills since she was 15.

sense.name: die
sense.examples: Since my old man popped off at 46, I'm a tad conscious of trying to survive long enough to see me kids through uni.
